title: Optometrist - Bangalore
description:
## Job Description

**Role:** Optometrist

**Job Description:** Dispenses accurate prescriptions and fits spectacles, contact lenses and other optical aids. Performs refraction and diagnosis to meet customers needs, providing advice on lens types, frames, styling, contact lenses, care, use of low vision aids, adjustments, and repairs to spectacles. Manages inventory of lenses and optical products, giving inputs on orders. Provides regular qualitative and quantitative reports to management on sales and stock, and customer feedback to facilitate decision making. Ensures quality of eye measurements and regularly audits fitments and dispensing techniques of Opticians; acts as the point of escalation for Opticians for higher consultation.

**Education Required:** D. Optom / B Optom / M Optom

**Experience Required:** 0-10 Yrs

**Required Skills & Competencies:** Welcome the customer appropriately, talk about Vision Express products/services, tell the customer about the Vx- 6 step Eye test (free of cost), advise customer on what suits and benefits them, ensure timely delivery and prompt after-sales service, ensure back-end processes happen as per schedule, and escalate unsorted issues/disputes to the Store Manager (SM) if required.

title: Optometrist
description:
## Job Description

**Job Title:** Optometrist

**Reports To:** Store Manager

**Summary:** This role blends clinical expertise with retail excellence at Vision Express, focusing on customer experience, sales, operations, and customer engagement.

**Roles And Responsibilities:**
*   **Precision in Prescription & Dispensing:** Ensure accurate prescriptions, fit spectacles, contact lenses, and optical aids for clarity and comfort. Guide customers in selecting lenses and frames.
*   **Beyond the Clinic:** Conduct comprehensive eye tests and diagnoses, offer expert advice on lens types, frame styles, and contact lens care, and help customers understand how eyewear enhances daily life.
*   **Managing Optical Inventory & Product Expertise:** Manage inventory, analyze customer trends, provide insights for product offerings, and stay updated on latest lens technologies/eyewear trends.
*   **Driving Business with Data & Insights:** Share insights on customer preferences, provide reports on sales/stock/optical trends, and partner with the team to drive business growth.
*   **Ensuring Quality & Expert Consultation:** Maintain high standards of precision in eye measurements and dispensing techniques, audit optical quality standards, and act as the expert for complex cases.

**Qualifications:** Graduation or Diploma in Optometry.

**Experience:** 0 to 7 years in retail and optical industry.

**Skills & Competencies:** Optometry, Refraction, Contact lens knowledge.

**Top 5 KPIs:** Footfall to Eye Test Conversion, Eye Test to Sales Conversion, Individual Sales Achievement, Customer Satisfaction & Retention, Zero error eye testing.

**Benefits:** Free Spectacle from day one, Group Hospitalization/Term Life/Personal Accidental Insurance, Referral incentive, Free unlimited consultation for employees and family members by in-house doctors, Monthly Recognition Program, REFERS toll-free for medical/emergencies.

title: Optometrist
description:
## Job Description

**Dispenses and Fits Accurate Prescriptions:** Dispenses accurate prescriptions and fits spectacles, contact lenses and other optical aids.

**Refraction, diagnosis and Customer Consultation:** Performs refraction and diagnosis to meet customers needs, providing advice to patients on lens types, frames, styling, fitting contact lenses and care, use of low vision aids, adjustments, and repairs to spectacles.

**Inventory Management:** Manages inventory of lenses and optical products, providing inputs on orders.

**Reporting:** Provides regularly, necessary qualitative and quantitative reports to management on sales, stock, and customer feedback.

**Quality Control and Consultant:** Ensures quality of eye measurements and regularly audits fitments and dispensing techniques of Opticians. This role is the point of escalation for Opticians for cases which require higher consultation.

title: Optometrist
company: Sir H.N. Reliance Foundation Hospital & Research Centre

title: Optometrist
company: Sir H.N. Reliance Foundation Hospital & Research Centre
description:
## Job Description

**Candidate Requirement:** Graduation or PG in Optometry, Basic computer and typing skills, Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

**Job Profile:** Responsible for upkeep & calibration of all department equipment. Liaise with Biomedical Engineer for smooth functioning of equipment. Report damage to instruments/equipment and follow up for replacement. Assist/perform procedures or tests as per qualifications. Conduct detailed optometry workup for all OPD, EHC & IPD patients. Conduct OPD Procedures including Perimetry, OCT, Topography, IOL Master, Fundus Camera, FFA, A-Scan, B-Scan, Pachymetry, Specular microscopy. Follow standard operating procedures, including obtaining consent forms, counselling, and safety checklists. Support in transferring and positioning patients in OT on need basis.

**Skills:** Clinical assessment, Prescription writing, Ocular health evaluation, Contact lens fitting, Visual acuity testing, Patient communication, Eye examination, Optical dispensing.

title: Optometrist - Delhi - New Delhi Hub
description:
## About The Role

The Optometrist role at Lenskart is dual, combining technical expertise (eye-checks, dispensing, diagnosis) with sales as a critical deliverable. The goal is to deliver an exceptional customer experience.

**Responsibilities:**
*   **Customer focus:** Drive Net Promoter Score; greet and welcome walk-in customers and guide them toward the free eye check-up clinic.
*   Involve in stocktakes, maintain sales floor standards, and execute day-to-day tasks.
*   Understand the POS system for effective transaction processing.
*   Dedicated to customer satisfaction and resolving concerns.
*   **Eye check-up & dispensing:** Follow the 12-step Optometry process. Share the prescription clearly, educate the customer about single vision/progressive lenses, and recommend appropriate lenses/frames. Perform quality check of fitted lenses before handover.
*   **Product recommendation:** Present an optimal selection of products based on customer preferences. Understand unstated needs and pitch recommended solutions at the right time.
*   **Achieving sales Vs. Plan & SOP adherence:** Achieve targets for sales, eye-test conversion, and returns; follow all SOPs. Coordinate product pick-up and resolve returns issues.
*   **Store upkeep & maintenance:** Maintain the store as per Lenskart standards, clean equipment, ensure no deviation from SOP, and ensure security of equipment and stock.

**Personal attributes & competencies:** Minimum qualification is Diploma in Optometry. Attributes include ability to build rapport, understand unstated needs, clear communication, active listening, adaptability, proactive task ownership, result-orientation, customer-orientation, and multitasking.

title: Optician
company: Spandana Heart and Super Speciality Hospital
description:
## Job Overview

Spandana Hospital is seeking a Junior Optician to join the team in Bangalore, with opportunities for both full-time and part-time employment.

**Qualifications And Skills:** Proficiency in eyewear repairs (Mandatory), expertise in lens fitting (Mandatory), skilled in prescription interpretation (Mandatory), strong inventory management skills, experience in frame adjustment, comprehensive product knowledge, excellent communication skills, and attention to detail.

**Roles And Responsibilities:** Assist patients in selecting the right eyewear based on prescriptions and preferences. Fit and adjust frames for comfort and visual adherence. Perform lens insertion and adjustments. Conduct repairs and maintenance of eyewear. Manage and organize inventory. Educate patients on proper eyewear care. Collaborate with medical staff for comprehensive eye care. Maintain records of patient interactions and sales.

**Experience:** 1 to 3 years of experience in opticianry.

title: Regional Trainer I Optometry Trainer - Mumbai
description:
## Job Summary: Optometry Regional Trainer

The Field Trainer is responsible for delivering hands-on training and development programs to employees in the field to equip them with necessary skills and knowledge.

**Key Responsibilities:**
*   **Training Delivery:** Deliver engaging in-field training sessions, workshops, and one-on-one coaching. Conduct structured programs on refraction, dispensing techniques, and optical technical processes. Train retail staff on fundamentals of lenses, frames, and prescription interpretation. Facilitate workshops, role-plays, and incorporate innovative team-building activities.
*   **Customer Experience Training:** Educate staff on delivering an exceptional customer journey and conduct training on effective communication, consultations, and accurate eye tests. Ensure compliance with company policies.
*   **Performance Monitoring & Feedback:** Regularly visit retail stores to assess training effectiveness and staff performance. Conduct mock sessions and quality audits; provide timely feedback and actionable insights. Develop assessments to measure knowledge retention.
*   **Content Development & Upgradation:** Design and maintain training modules, presentations, and manuals based on evolving needs. Stay updated with industry trends.
*   **Continuous Improvement:** Gather trainee feedback, identify skill gaps, and customize programs. Foster a learning culture and travel as needed.

**Qualifications & Skills:** Preferably Bachelor's/Master's in Optometry. Strong presentation, communication, organizational, and time-management skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and e-learning platforms. Willingness to travel extensively.

title: Optometrist
description:
## Eligibility

**Minimum qualification:** Bachelor’s or Diploma in Optometry or Ophthalmic Assistance.

**Dispensing Optician role:** Candidate must have completed a vision screening course for a minimum of 2 years.

title: Cluster Optometrist - RON 1
description:
## About The Role

The Cluster Optometrist role at Lenskart is a blend of optometry and optical retail. The role involves upskilling front-end retail staff on professional optometry grounds and delivering the best customer experience by driving key business metrics with an optometric approach. Key deliverable is maintaining eye test quality and dispensing standards.

**Responsibilities (Area Activities):**
*   **Store Visit:** Must visit assigned stores and manage the complete Technical and Functional part of Lenskart stores in uniform.
*   **In Store Duty:** Act as a Mentor and Coach to Fresher Optometrists, helping with Sales Pitch, Technical Dispensing Guidance, Troubleshooting, and Customer Query Handling. Must also work as a store optometrist during busy hours/high sale days or to cover shifts, checking eye tests, QC drawers, CL expiry, merchandise, Instrument calibration, etc.. Ensure Store Net Promoter Score (NPS) is achieved through training, troubleshooting, and tracking detractors.
*   **Manpower:** Welcome new talent, conduct interviews, and prepare/conduct meetings with respective Area Operations Managers (AOMs).
*   **Training:** Undertake regular reviews for new staff, analyze SOPs (eye test, quality check, dispensing, contact lens, troubleshoot, deliver) to measure training impact, and identify/train staff to achieve goals.
*   **Audit:** Periodically audit eye test and dispensing performance.
*   **Team Leader:** Serve as Team leader, Bench, Senior, and Consultant Optometrist to support the store team.
*   **Revenue:** Maximise In-Store Revenue through continuous training, periodic reviews, increasing eye tests done at store, and reducing returns.
*   **Team Work:** Work as a member of the Business Team and participate in regional/departmental meetings.
*   **Documentation:** Maintain documentation and Report daily to the PS regional manager on store visit summary.

**Working Hours:** Same as store shift, and must work on weekends/public holidays.

**Personal attributes & competencies:** Minimum qualification is Diploma in Optometry with minimum 3 years of retail experience. Good knowledge in Optometry, Refraction, Eyewear Products, Dispensing, and Measurements. Must be ready to travel anywhere in India. Attributes include passion for Sales, Retail, Customer service, and Training, good understanding of market/product analysis, and leadership qualities (lead by example, coaching, motivating).

title: Tele Optom - Uttar Pradesh - Lucknow
description:
## About The Role: Tele Optometry Or Remote Optometry

Tele-optometry involves assessing a customer's ocular health via telecommunication technology. This role delivers live vision care and ocular services remotely, supported by an in-store technician and team. The focus is testing customer vision, ensuring correction efficacy, and completing eye testing to recommend prescriptions/frames/lenses. This is an in-office, full-time job (minimum 9 hours of work for 6 days).

**Responsibilities:**
*   Establish remote connect with customers to understand visual challenges and needs.
*   Conduct remote eye tests with protocol and accepted standards.
*   Complete remote eye testing and provide education on recommended visual aids.
*   Assist with screening eye conditions and making referrals when possible.
*   Explain benefits of corrective aids and how they improve eye health.
*   Advise customer upon the next scheduled eye test date (suggested 6 months period).
*   Update customer power in systems and navigate customer to download Digital Prescription via Lenskart App.
*   Track and maintain required eye test quantum, eye to buy conversions, and eye test quality metrics.

**Requirements:** Diploma/Degree/Master in Optometry. Technical Proficiencies (basic computer, MS windows), excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to form relationships, demonstrated knowledge of various optometry equipment, and strong problem-solving skills.

title: Tele-Optometrist (Remote – Night Shift, India)
description:
## About the Role

This Tele-Optometrist role supports U.S.-based brick-and-mortar clinics via secure telehealth platforms. The candidate will perform accurate refractions, guide patients through vision assessments, and document findings in EMR systems.

**Key Responsibilities:** Conduct comprehensive refractions using digital or manual foropters. Connect remotely to U.S. clinics via secure telehealth systems. Guide patients through vision tests and record results accurately. Communicate clearly with patients and clinic staff. Troubleshoot basic technical issues. Maintain patient privacy, data accuracy, and professional bedside manner.

**Requirements:** Doctor of Optometry (OD) or equivalent degree recognized in India. Minimum 3 years of hands-on clinical optometry or refraction experience. Strong English fluency (spoken and written). Ability to work night shifts aligned with U.S. time zones. Willingness to complete HIPAA and telehealth compliance training. Experience using digital or automated foropters preferred.

title: Optometrist-Angul- Odisha (FOFO)
description:
## Job Description

**Responsibilities:** Conduct eye exams, assess vision, test visual acuity. Diagnose and treat visual issues like nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism. Prescribe and fit eyeglasses and contact lenses. Detect eye diseases such as glaucoma and macular degeneration. Provide pre and post-operative care to patients undergoing eye surgery. Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in optometry. Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team.

*   **Manpower:** Welcome new talent, conduct interviews, and prepare/conduct meetings with respective AOMs.
*   **Training:** Undertake regular reviews for new staff, analyze SOPs to measure training impact, and identify/train staff to achieve goals.
*   **Audit:** Periodically audit eye test and dispensing performance.
*   **Team Leader:** Serve as Team leader, Bench, Senior, and Consultant Optometrist.
*   **Revenue:** Maximise In-Store Revenue through continuous training, periodic reviews, increasing eye tests done at store, and reducing returns.

**Personal attributes & competencies:** Minimum qualification is Diploma in Optometry with minimum 3 years of retail experience. Must be ready to travel anywhere in India. Attributes include passion for Sales, Retail, Customer service, and Training, good understanding of market/product analysis, and leadership qualities.

title: Optometrist - Bangalore - Karnataka (FOFO)
description:
## Job Description

**Responsibilities:** Conduct eye examinations to evaluate the health and quality of patients' vision. Perform tests for visual acuity, focusing, and coordination. Diagnose sight problems (e.g., nearsightedness, farsightedness) and eye diseases (e.g., glaucoma). Prescribe eyeglasses, contact lenses, and other visual aids. Provide advice on proper eye care techniques. Maintain detailed records of patient information and treatment plans.

**Requirements:** Bachelor's or Doctorate degree in Optometry. Valid license to practice optometry. Strong knowledge of refraction, retinoscopy, and other relevant optometry skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to work well in a team, attention to detail, and strong problem-solving abilities. Only candidates with 0 to 3 years of experience will be considered.

title: Cluster Optometrist
description:
## About The Role

title: Optometrist - Uttar Pradesh - Lucknow Hub
description:
## About The Role (Optometrist/Sr. Optometrist)

This role combines eye check-ups with sales as a critical deliverable, focusing on delivering technical expertise through eye-checks, dispensing, and diagnosis.

**Responsibilities:**
*   **Customer focus:** Drive Net Promoter Score; greet and guide walk-in customers toward the free eye check-up clinic.
*   Involve in stocktakes, maintain sales floor standards, and execute day-to-day tasks.
*   Understand the POS system for effective transaction processing and resolve customer concerns.
*   **Eye check-up & dispensing:** Follow the 12-step Optometry process. Share the prescription clearly, educate the customer about single vision/progressive lenses, and recommend appropriate visual aids. Perform quality check of fitted lenses before handover.
*   **Product recommendation:** Present an optimal selection of products based on customer preferences and actively pitch recommended solutions.
*   **Achieving sales Vs. Plan & SOP adherence:** Achieve targets for sales, eye-test conversion, and returns; follow all SOPs. Coordinate product pick-up and resolve returns issues.
*   **Store upkeep & maintenance:** Maintain the store as per Lenskart standards, clean equipment, and ensure the security of assets.

**Personal attributes & competencies:** Minimum qualification is Diploma in Optometry. Attributes include ability to build rapport, understand unstated needs, clear communication, adaptability, and Proactive task ownership.

title: Optometry Specialist
description:
## Role Description: Service Engineer (Optometry Specialist role title used in source)

This is a full-time, on-site role located in Gurugram for a Service Engineer. The engineer is responsible for troubleshooting, technical support, field service, maintenance, and repair of ophthalmic equipment. Daily tasks include diagnosing problems, conducting repairs, ensuring optimal performance, and maintaining high standards of customer service.

**Qualifications:** Troubleshooting and Technical Support skills, Field Service experience, Strong Communication skills, Maintenance & Repair skills, Customer service orientation, and ability to work independently. Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Engineering or related field. Experience in the ophthalmic or medical device industry is a plus.

title: Optometrist- Silliguri- WB (FOFO)
description:
## Job Description

**Responsibilities:** Perform comprehensive eye exams. Prescribe corrective lenses and provide vision therapy. Diagnose and treat eye-related disorders. Monitor patients for systemic conditions affecting the eyes. Stay updated on the latest research and technologies in optometry. Conduct eye examinations to detect vision problems and prescribe visual aids. Diagnose sight problems (e.g., nearsightedness or color blindness) and provide treatment for visual issues and eye diseases. Educate patients on proper eye care techniques.

**Requirements:** Bachelor's degree in Optometry or relevant field. Valid Optometrist license. Good clinical skills, attention to detail, strong communication and interpersonal abilities, and ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

title: Optometrist - Pune -Baner - Maharashtra (FOFO)
description:
## Job Description

**Eye check-up & dispensing:** Follow the 12-step Optometry process. Share the prescription clearly and educate the customer about lens types (single vision and progressive) while recommending appropriate visual aids. Perform a quality check of fitted lenses before handover.

**Product recommendation:** Present the customer with an optimal selection of products based on preferences. Understand the unstated needs of the customer and pitch recommended solutions.

**Achieving sales Vs. Plan & SOP adherence:** Achieve targets for sales, eye-test conversion, and returns; follow all SOPs. Coordinate product pick-up and resolve returns issues.

title: Optometrist
description:
## Eligibility

**Minimum qualification:** Bachelor’s or Diploma in Optometry or Ophthalmic Assistance.

**Dispensing Optician role:** Candidate must have completed a vision screening course for a minimum of 2 years.
